info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 2:42PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Lea County through 330 PM MDT... Cold air funnels have been reported with these storms. These funnels do not typically reach the ground, but if they do wind speeds are similar to that of a strong dust devil. These storms are near Crossroads, or 12 miles north of Tatum, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tatum, Caprock, McDonald, Crossroads, Gladiola and Tatum Airport. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
